intro: Diosma hyponeura, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces berries that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for certain wildlife. Diosma hyponeura is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots that help it access underground water sources. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
